subject: resource/Abraham_Kuyper
object: Abraham Kuijper /ˈkaɪpər/ (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈaːbraːɦɑm ˈkœypər]; 29 October 1837 – 8 November 1920), generally known as Abraham Kuyper, was a Dutch journalist, statesman and Neo-Calvinist theologian. He was a master organiser.  He founded a new church (the Gereformeerde Kerken), a newspaper, the Free University of Amsterdam, and the Anti-Revolutionary Party. He served as Prime Minister of the Netherlands between 1901 and 1905.

To evaluate whether the information in the documents supports the triple "Abraham Kuyper was a Dutch journalist", I will analyze the context information.

The relevant sentences from the documents are:

* Abraham Kuyper was a man of—how to put this?—several interests. Wikipedia, the vox populi, introduces Kuyper thus: ... He established the Reformed Churches in the Netherlands... and a newspaper.
* So: Kuyper was a pastor who founded a large denomination; a politician who founded a political party and eventually rose to Prime Minister; a journalist who founded a newspaper; and an educator who founded a university.
* Abraham Kuyper (1837-1920) was a Dutch Reformed theologian and politician who founded the Reformed Churches in the Netherlands and the Free University. He emphasized that Jesus is Lord over all areas of life...
* Abraham Kuyper was a Dutch pastor, theologian, politician, journalist, and statesman.
* Abraham Kuyper | Introduction... Born on October 29, 1837, in Maassluis, Netherlands, Kuyper's life and work played a significant role in shaping the cultural, religious, and political landscape of his time and beyond. Kuyper's early life was marked by a solid educational foundation.
* Abraham Kuyper, a prominent figure in Dutch politics and theology during the late 19th and early 20th centuries, had a profound impact on both the political landscape of the Netherlands and the development of Christian political thought.

From these sentences, it is clear that Abraham Kuyper was indeed a journalist who founded a newspaper. Therefore, the information in the documents supports the triple "Abraham Kuyper was a Dutch journalist".
